page.title: 03AREA CHANGES II - PATHHEAD
page.content: The old houses of Pathhead were knocked down ten/fifteen years ago. They were so old that the toilets were outside. Some of the people who lived there were rehoused in the new multi storey flats. It used to be a very busy area but shops and factories have closed down because people started to buy carpets instead of linoleum. Most of the men worked at the linoleum factories. Pathhead used to have a selection of entertainment. They had the Rio and Carlton cinemas. They also had the Pathhead Concert hall. Now they only have the Kingsway Bingo Hall. British Rail closed down the railway station because of lack of profit. There is one listed building in Pathhead. It is the Feuars Arms. It stands alone in the middle of delerict streets. Someday the area will be rebuilt.
